sentences.en: After lengthy talks the two sides finally reached a compromise .
sentences.cn: 双方经过长期的商谈终于达成了妥协。

sentences.en: Be prepared to make compromises .
sentences.cn: 你要准备作出妥协。

sentences.en: Compromise is an inevitable part of marriage.
sentences.cn: 妥协是婚姻生活中必不可少的。

sentences.en: He did not allow his preconceptions to compromise his scientific work.
sentences.cn: 他不允许自己的先入之见破坏自己的科学工作。

sentences.en: He would rather shoot himself than compromise his principles.
sentences.cn: 他宁愿一枪打死自己也不愿违背自己的原则。

sentences.en: I was not going to compromise.
sentences.cn: 我决不妥协。

sentences.en: If moderates fail to reach a compromise , the extremists will dominate the agenda.
sentences.cn: 如果温和派不能达成妥协，激进派就会主宰议事日程。

sentences.en: Luxembourg sketched out an acceptable compromise between Britain, France and Germany.
sentences.cn: 卢森堡草拟了一项英国、法国和德国之间都可以接受的妥协方案。

sentences.en: Mr Clarke has shown himself to be resolutely opposed to compromise.
sentences.cn: 克拉克先生已表示自己坚决反对妥协。

sentences.en: Neither party is willing to compromise and herein lies the problem.
sentences.cn: 双方都不愿意妥协，问题就在这里。

sentences.en: She admitted that she was unable to compromise.
sentences.cn: 她承认自己无法作出妥协。

sentences.en: The foreign ministers have thrashed out a suitable compromise formula.
sentences.cn: 外交部长们经过反复讨论，已经制订出合适的折中方案。

sentences.en: The legislation represents in itself an unhappy compromise.
sentences.cn: 这项立法本身就是勉强妥协的产物。

sentences.en: The President spoke of the need for territorial compromise.
sentences.cn: 总统谈到了在领土问题上达成和解的必要性。

sentences.en: The spokesman made it evident that no compromise was yet in sight.
sentences.cn: 发言人表示,目前还不会妥协.

sentences.en: Their problem can only be solved in a spirit of compromise.
sentences.cn: 他们的问题只能通过妥协来解决。

sentences.en: They are meeting in Lusaka in an attempt to reach a compromise.
sentences.cn: 他们在卢萨卡举行会谈试图达成妥协。

sentences.en: They defiantly rejected any talk of a compromise.
sentences.cn: 他们轻蔑地拒绝任何提及妥协的内容。

sentences.en: To stop the argument they decided on a compromise.
sentences.cn: 为停止争吵，他们决定作出妥协。

sentences.en: Trade ministers patched up a compromise.
sentences.cn: 贸易部长们艰难地达成了妥协。

trans.tran_cn: 折中，妥协方案，达成协议
trans.tran_en: an agreement that is achieved after everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first, or the act of making this agreement
an agreement that is achieved after everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first, or the act of making this agreement
to reach an agreement in which everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first
an agreement that is achieved after everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first, or the act of making this agreement
to reach an agreement in which everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first
to do something which is against your principles and which therefore seems dishonest or shameful
